dt: {bc}to relieve from exposure to danger {bc}act to make safe against adverse contingencies

dt.t: {wi}secure{/wi} a supply line from enemy raids

dt: {bc}to put beyond hazard of losing or of not receiving {bc}{sx|guarantee||}
{bc}to give pledge of payment to (a creditor) or of (an obligation)

dt.t: {wi}secure{/wi} a note by a pledge of collateral

dt: {bc}to get secure usually lasting possession or control of
{bc}to release (naval personnel) from work or duty

pt: {sc}ensure{/sc} {sc}insure{/sc} {sc}assure{/sc} {sc}secure{/sc} mean to make a thing or person sure. {sc}ensure{/sc} {sc}insure{/sc}, and {sc}assure{/sc} are interchangeable in many contexts where they indicate the making certain or inevitable of an outcome, but {sc}ensure{/sc} may imply a virtual guarantee

pt.t: the government has {it}ensured{/it} the safety of the refugees

pt: , while {sc}insure{/sc} sometimes stresses the taking of necessary measures beforehand

pt.t: careful planning should {it}insure{/it} the success of the party

pt: , and {sc}assure{/sc} distinctively implies the removal of doubt and suspense from a person's mind.

pt.t: I {it}assure{/it} you that no harm will be done

pt: {sc}secure{/sc} implies action taken to guard against attack or loss.

shortdef: to relieve from exposure to danger : act to make safe against adverse contingencies
to put beyond hazard of losing or of not receiving : guarantee
to give pledge of payment to (a creditor) or of (an obligation)
